60 Amazing Bali Tourist Attractions To Visit In 2025

..
SHARES
Updated Date: 5 March 2025

Holding the dignity of being the most visited Island of Indonesia, Bali is a mesmerising place packed with majestic temples and historical monument. The island offers many experiences to visitors such as thrillophillic adventure spots. There are many Bali tourist attarctions that allow you to get familiar with its rich cultural heriage, as well as providing a charming experience to add in your travel diaries. Bali has so many gems in its kitty that even a week-long vacation is not enough to explore the whole island. From scenic beauty to enthralling water sportsadventure along with spending leisurely hours beside serene beaches, is what a holiday in Bali is all about! So, are you feeling excited to explore the island country like a true local? Take a look to know what will suit you the best on your tropical vacay for a memorable trip with the best Bali tourist attractions.


Table Of Content

1. Ubud - Natures Delight

Ubud is a complete package of the best tourist places in Bali. It just cannot be described in words. It's a magical paradise that is best explored. From nature to culture, this place is a condensed Indonesia showcasing its culture through paddy fields, temples, street dance performances, and museums. So, when you are visiting Bali, make sure you add Ubud to your itinerary! Flaunting its art, culture, and wellness scenes, Ubud is also packed with many spiritual shops and yoga retreats to help rejuvenate your soul and mind.

Location:Ubud, Bali, Indonesia

Timings:9 AM to 6 PM

Entry fee:NA

Things to do: Explore the scenic vistas on a bike; stroll through Tegallalangs terraced rice fields; visit the bamboo mansions; encounter flocking herons at Petulu; monkey around at the macaque-inhabited Monkey Park.

Highlights:Unwind and relax with countless spiritual workshops and Yoga retreats.

Also Read: Bali In July

2. Lovina - Black Sands

With black sand spread over an area of 5 miles, Lovina Beach is the largest resort area on the north coast of Bali. Encompassing several small villages, it is a welcome break from the hustle of the southern tourist attractions. The beach is fortified with black and grey volcanic sand and is a popular spot to watch and enjoy dolphin tours. Thrill seekers are welcome to indulge in various water sports, such as diving and snorkelling. Lovina Beach is listed among the top Bali tourist attractions, offering calm and warm surroundings. You can also enjoy delicious food at various food stalls and cafes located at Lovina Beach.

Location:Lovina Beach, Bali, Indonesia

Timings:8 AM to 5 PM

Entry fee:Free

Things to do: Go snorkelling and scuba diving in the calm sea; watch the dolphins; take a spa; visit the hot water spring at Banjar

Highlights:Unwind and relax at a laid-back beach and enjoy diving and snorkelling.

3. Mount And Lake Batur - Magnificent Views

Also known as Kintamani volcano, Mount Batur is one of the most dramatic landscapes for sightseeing in Bali. With a magnificent view of its 13 sq km caldera and a beautiful lake filling a large part of the caldera, it offers a fantastic spectacle to visitors. Fortified with natural charm, cultural significance, and an active volcano that has erupted many times, Mount Batur is among the famous Bali Tourist attractions. Here, visitors can enjoy charming sightseeing, hiking, walking tours, and pine forest exploration.

Location: Mount Batur, Kintamani, Bali, Indonesia

Timings:8 AM to 5 PM

Entry fee: IDR 500,000

Things to do: Visit Pura Ulun Danu Batur, linger around the craters on the mountain, swim in the hot springs, and ride a bike through the ancient villages.

Highlights: Trek to the peak before sunrise, soak yourself in the beautiful sunrise and have a breakfast of eggs boiled in the volcano

Related Post: Bali Luxury Resorts

4. Nusa Lembongan - Serene Sights

Did you need permission from an elder to enter the city if you were in a car? Welcome to Nusa Lembongan Island! No hawkers, no traffic, turquoise water, and mushroom-shaped coral offshore are how they introduce this small island off Bali's southeastern shores. The place is known for popular breaks such as Shipwrecks, Playgrounds and Lacreations. Here, you can also explore many beaches and indulge in water activities. Flaunting its natural charm, Nusa Lembongan is an amusing place among Bali tourist attractions.

Location:Nusa Lrmbongan, Bali, Indonesia

Timings:7 AM to 10 PM

Entry fee:NA

Things to do: Surf at Mushroom Bay; go diving, snorkelling, and cruise ride; visit seaweed farms; discover the hidden dream beach

Highlights: Boat to Mangrove Park and explore the serenity

5. Sanur Beach - Tree-Lined Streets

A tree-lined street and shady beachfront in the village of Denpasar in southeast Bali, Sanur Beach has long kept itself away from the changes of the morbid world. It houses some critical must-see places in Bali that have preserved their histories in its temples and museums. Here, visitors can also indulge in various watersports such as Kitesurfing, windsurfing, snorkelling, surfing and wakeboarding. The place offers a calm environment where travellers can unwind and relax with their friends and family.

Location: Sanur Beach, Bali, Indonesia

Timings:24 hours

Entry fee:Free

Things to do: Go for kite flying, kayaking, wind and kite surfing, parasailing, fishing, and a glass bottom boat ride

Highlights: Get up early and watch the sunrise by the beach; track starfishes while the tides are low (do keep them back where you found them)

Related Post: Famous Villages In Bali

6. Kuta Beach - White Sand Beach

A melting sun over the white sandy beach in the evening, flavoured with sizzling seafood at the beachside cafesthat's what an everyday afternoon looks like at Kuta Beach. Once a sleepy fishing village, it has remained Bali's premier vacation destination ever since its renovation in the late 1970s and is the best western Kuta beach. Its consistent waves makes this beach a perfect surfing location. Along with enjoying the joyful day with watersports, you can also dive into an immersive nightlife experience at Kuta Beach, one of the best Bali tourist attractions.

Location:Kuta Beach, Bali, Indonesia

Timings:8 AM to 5 PM

Entry fee: Free

Things to do: Experience 3D trick art at Dream Museum Zone; cruise in style on the roads with vintage rides; get wet at Circus Waterpark; pay a visit to Kuta Sea Turtle Conservation site; watch Kuta Theater

Highlights: Ride the beach on a horse; trip to the north end and count the passing planes while the sun lowers down; drive through the picturesque toll bridge

7. Pura Luhur Uluwatu - Beautiful Statues Of Ganesha

Statues of Ganesha flank the entrance, monkeys begging for treats from visitors, and evening dance showsthis is just another day at Pura Luhur Uluwatu. Built on a steep limestone cliff jutting over the sea, it feels like being perched on a throne. Here, visitors can witness a mesmerising sunset view, which will surely amuse their eyes and senses. Apart from this, don't miss the Kecak dance performance, where 75 male dancers perform at an arena near the temple every evening. There are many things to do near Pura Luhur Uluwatu.

Location: Pecatu, South Kuta, Badung Regency, Bali, Indonesia

Timings:7 AM to 7 PM

Entry fee:IDR 50000

Things to do: Explore the sunset delight from the cliff; daily Kecak dance performances; explore the traditionally designed gateways; historic sculptures and Balinese architecture

Highlights: Seafood dinner at Jimbaran Beach while the sun melts down at a distance, the anniversary celebration that takes place every six months according to the Balinese 210-day Pawukon cycle

Related Post: Shopping In Bali

8. Tanah Lot - Significant Sea Temple

Among the seven sea temples, each within the eyesight of the next is the Tanah Lot Temple tour. Situated on a large rock, it is one of the most iconic Bali tourist attractions for photography and exoticism. Adorned with intricate architecture, the temple contains various smaller shrines and pavilions that display many carvings and sculptures. Apart from seeking blessings at this blissful temple, visitors can also witness stunning sunset vistas, which will surely delight your eyes and senses.

Location: Beraban, Kediri, Tabanan Regency, Bali 82121, Indonesia

Timings:6 AM to 7 PM

Entry fee:IDR 750000

Things to do: Stroll along the beach, sunbathe, watch the sunset, dine and experiment with the local cuisine

Highlights: Enjoy Surfing and swimming

9. Seminyak - Southwestern Coast Of Bali

A small town on the southwestern coast of Bali, Seminyak is famous for its high-end boutiques and five-star restaurants. Among Bali tourist attractions, it has treacherous surf and offers a perfect adventure with a panoramic background. Packed with various lavish hotels and various places to visit in Seminyk, this place is known for offering a delightful staycation experience to all visitors and travellers. Here, visitors can relax at laid-back beaches and enjoy the stunning vistas of turquoise waters. Also, don't forget to have delicious food at various restaurants, cafes, and bars in Seminyak.

Location:Seminyak, Bali, Indonesia

Timings:10 AM to 10 PM

Entry fee: Free

Things to do: Indulge in cheap daily massage; watch the gorgeous sunset; shop; chill out at the pool parties; pose at Bali Trick Art Gallery; surf the seas; feel blessed at the Pura Petitenget temple.

Highlights: Cocktails at a cliff at The Rock Bar; a splash in Waterbom water park.

Related Post: Hostels In Bali

10. Pura Besakih - Highest Mountain

The slopes of Gunung Agung house Bali's highest mountain, Pura Besakih, one of the best tourist attractions in Bali. Legends say that this nine-directional temple was built to protect the island from evil. With 28 structures on terraces, it is surrounded by scenic rice paddies, lush forests, and vegetation. Pura Besakih is the largest and most significant temple in Balinese Hinduism, dating back over a thousand years and packed with 23 temples.

Location: Besakih, Rendang, Karangasem Regency, Bali 80863, Indonesia

Timings:8 AM to 6 PM

Entry fee: IDR 150,000

Things to do: Visit a temple, tour the Edelweiss Garden, and trek, hike, and campat Mount Agung.

Highlights:Enjoy the blissful environment and seek blessings at temple

 

11. Mount Agung - Highest Peak In Bali

Mount Agung is not just Balis spiritual centre but also its highest peak. A very revered mountain of Bali, Mount Agungs peaks are shrouded in mist and clouds. The mountain looks scenic and a beauty to behold during dawn. Its picturesque beauty is perfect for photography. Trekking and rock climbing are favoured activities in Mount Agung, and they start early. It is among the best places to see in Bali. This is an active volcano fortified with a large crater and known for amusing the eyes and senses of visitors.

Location:Mount Agung, Bali, Indonesia

Timings:8 AM to 5 PM

Entry fee:Free

Things to do: Take beautiful mountain pictures, go trekking, and engage in Rock Climbing.

Highlights: The Mountains beauty at dawn.

Related Post: Places To Visit In Bali For Honeymoon

12. Tulamben - Thrilling Adventures

Balis beaches are a beauty on the surface but theres more than meets the eye with them. You can also go underwater to see a world beyond anything ever seen before. To start off this thrilling adventure, you can begin from Tulamben and its shipwreck remains and end at Pemuteran, which has the largest rock reef of all. Bali has something for everyone and is suitable for all levels and divers. Its advisable to go diving during the dry months. One place that cant be missed is Nusa Penida Island, which has all its beauty as there are many things to do in Tulamben.

Location:Tulamben, Bali, Indonesia

Timings:NA

Entry fee:NA

Things to do: Enjoy surfing, Visit the bio rocks, see shipwreck remains, take photographs, and more.

Highlights:Enjoy watersports and thrilling activities

13. Nungnung Waterfall - Mesmerizing Views

Air Terjun Nungnung, lies between Bedugul and Ubud. It is a beautiful waterfall which is just the perfect place to refresh yourself and recharge your senses. Situated around 900 meters above sea level, the waterfall is surrounded by beautiful lush greenery and is a welcoming sight for nature lovers as well. There are many places to visit near Nungnung Waterfall. Bring your camera with you to take some amazing photographs. It should be noted that this water isnt ideal for swimming, and the 500-step pathway leading to it can be taxing for many.

Location:Nungnung Waterfall, Bali, Indonesia

Timings:9 AM to 4 PM

Entry fee:IDR 20000

Things to do: Take amazing photographs of the place and relax there.

Highlights: Even if you dont climb up the 500 steps, do take a look at it; you will surely be in awe.

Related Post: Bali In January

14. Bali Bird And Reptile Park - Rare Excursions

As one can expect from the title, the Bali Bird and Reptile Park is a fun place for kids, adults, and families who love those animals. The park houses around 1000 birds along with a whopping 250 species of reptiles. Its the perfect place to head to for nature lovers and for those who want to do something different and enjoy being surrounded by animals. Dont forget to pack your camera for this trip, as the brightly coloured toucans are perfect for filling up your memory space. If you get tired during the tour, then no need to fret. There is s dining facility in there along with a shopping place from where you can get your souvenirs. It is among the best Bali tourist places.

Location: Batubulan, Sukawati, Gianyar Regency, Bali 80582, Indonesia

Timings:9 AM to 5 PM

Entry fee: IDR 100.000

Things to do: Walk around, take in the fresh surroundings, photograph the animals.

Highlights: The Toucans are entertaining; dont miss them.

15. Tukad Cepung Waterfall - Spellbinding Ambiance

Situated in the Tembuku region of Bangli Regency, this waterfall is a must-visit for its amazing views. You must undertake a 15-minute trek to reach the waterfall site, wading through gravel and waist-deep water. The whole effort is worth it, but ensure you are prepared. Once there, the sight of the beautiful Tukad Cepung waterfalls crashes as sunlight hits it through the canopy overhead, giving it an otherworldly ethereal vibe.

Location: Jl. Tembuku, Tembuku, Kec. Tembuku, Kabupaten Bangli, Bali 80671, Indonesia

Timings:7 AM to 6 PM

Entry fee: Rp 15,000

Things to do: Go trekking, take photographs of the beautiful waterfalls

Highlights: The canopy of trees above which are a vision of its own.

Related Post: Islands Around Bali

16. Ayung - For River Rafting

Rafting is actually a very popular sport in Bali, but white water rafting increases the difficulty level and, along with it, the thrill of it all. If you want to be part of the adventure, the Ayung River is the spot to head to. It is the largest river in Bali, located in Ubud. There are many places to visit near Ayung. A raft boat will take you over 10 km of thrill and adventure. It is suitable for all kinds of rafters, from beginners and full families, and there will be a professional trainer who will guide tourists and help them successfully navigate the distance full of 2 to 3-meter-long rapids. Numerous safety standards have been implemented to ensure the Ayung River experience is memorable.

Location:Ayung River, Bali, Indonesia

Timings:Daytime

Entry fee:NA

Things to do:River rafting, Real Bali Swing, Quad Adventure

Highlights: Enjoy adventurous river rafting in Ayung

17. Jimbaran Beach - Shimmering Lands

Jimbaran Bay Beach has everything which a beach lover could ever want. There are amazing coral reefs, luxury hotels, and sun loungers as well to complete the full experience. The beach is a shimmering land strip connecting the Bali mainland with the Bukit Peninsula. It is a very mellow place which is perfect for relaxing and offers tranquillity and peace to its visitors. There are many places to visit in Jimbaran beach. Enjoy the sound of the ocean in your ears as you sit underneath the vibrant green coconut tree groves. Picture perfect, this place truly offers all you could want; there are diverse dining options, so you can enjoy a delicious meal while watching the beautiful sunset.

Location:Jimbaran Beach, South Kuta, Bali, Indonesia

Timings:No fixed timings

Entry fee:Free

Things to do: Go coral reef watching, have a delicious meal, enjoy the sunset, engage in photography.

Highlights: Enjoy the sunset while here.

Related Post: Night Markets In Bali

18. Green Bowl Beach - Romantic Escapes

Bali has a whole range of beautiful beaches and so the list grows along with them. The green bowl beach is one of the most secluded in Bali. It is situated in Ungasan, which is around 15 mins away from any town nearby. The beach attracts fewer visitors because to get here one has to descend hundreds of steps first and this deters many. So, there are a few surfers and water adventure sports enthusiasts here. But it also makes it a perfect spot for relaxing and just enjoying the solitude of it all.

Location:Green Bowl Beach, Ungasan, Bali, Indonesia

Timings:5 AM to 5 PM

Entry fee:Free

Things to do: Visit the limestone caves present on the beach, bring your surfboards, and engage in a variety of adventure sports.

Highlights: Witness the limestone caves.

19. Tirta Empul - Heritage Site

Constructed in the year 962 AD, during the Warmadewa dynastys Reign, the Tirta Empul (also known as the Holy Water Temple) is a legacy of a tale of the victory of good over evil. It houses a holy mountain spring and feeds into the Pakerisan River. This holy place is revered for its ability to purify rituals by the devotees. Visitors can look at the temple carvings but cant participate in the ritual bath. Over there, look out for a beautiful 10th-century structure dedicated to Lord Vishnu. The temple is divided into three sections: the Nista Mandala, or the outer section; the Madya Mandala or the middle section; and the Utama Mandala. This place's rich carvings and lore make it a place not to be missed.

Location: Tampaksiring, Gianyar Regency, Bali 80552, Indonesia

Timings:8 AM to 6 PM

Entry fee:IDR 50000

Things to do: Visit the Sacred pool, admire the carvings and the deities, and look at the statues.

Highlights: The beauty of the carvings.

Related Post: Bali In November

20. Gitgit Waterfall - Refreshing Experience

Situated about 10 km from Singaraja. The Gitgit waterfalls are also known as Air Tejung Gitgit, and they offer a refreshing experience to visitors. To reach the 40-metre waterfall, visitors must traverse along a wooden walkway leading into a rocky pool. Take a dip in that cool pond before heading to the nearby Mekalongan waterfall. This is a great place to relax and be closer to nature. The water over at the waterfall actually splits into two different streams, giving the waterfall another name- Air Terjun Kembar Gitgit or Twin Falls. Its a great place for people wanting some peace and solitude. The cold falling water and the lush scenery make for a perfect spot.

Location: Jl. Raya Bedugul - Singaraja, Gitgit, Kec. Sukasada, Kabupaten Buleleng, Bali 81161, Indonesia

Timings: Open 24 hours

Entry fee:IDR 20000

Things to do: Take a dip in the cold pond, see the nearby Mekalongan waterfall, go trekking, or have a picnic.

Highlights: Witness the most scenic scenery of nature

21. Bali Safari And Marine Park - Theme Park

One of the most popular theme parks in Bali, Gianyar is home to more than 100 species of animals from countries like India, Indonesia, and more. Bali Safari and Marine Park also has endangered species like white tigers, Komodo dragons, and orangutans. You can get close to these amazing animals through the jeep safaris and animal rides offered there. This is a great place to visit with friends and family alike.

Location: Jl. Prof. Dr. Ida Bagus Mantra No.Km. 19,8, Serongga, Kec. Blahbatuh, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80551, Indonesia

Timings:9 AM to 5.30 PM, and 6 PM to 9 PM

Entry fee:IDR 750.000

Things to do: Enjoy the safaris, take pictures, go on animal rides.

Highlights: The safaris.

Related Post: Bali In December

22. Tegalalang Rice Terraces - Paddy Fields

These rice fields, situated around 20 minutes to the north of Ubud, are a break away from the usual types of commercialized structures that are seen. These beautiful, luscious Tegalalang rice terraces transition softly into paddy fields across the valley. These rice terraces are famous because they use an efficient 8th-century style of rice farming called Subak. It is a great place for some stunning photographs, you can later head off to have some coffee over at one of the quaint little cafes. Later on, take a detour to the Pakudui village to look at some amazing intricate wooden crafts. The rich culture of this place is increased by the feeling that you have stepped far back in time.

Location: Jl. Raya Tegallalang, Tegallalang, Kec. Tegallalang, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80561, Indonesia

Timings:6 AM to 7 PM

Entry fee:Rp 25.000

Things to do: Enjoy the Coffee over there, visit Gunung Kawi Sebatu Temple, admire the scenery from the swings, take a look at the Made Ada Museum, go on a cycling tour, look at the carvings.

Highlights: Take in the surroundings from the swing.

23. Sacred Monkey Forest Sanctuary - Rare Indulgences

It is a natural habitat of more than 600 Balinese long-tailed monkeys. The Sacred Monkey Forest Sanctuary is located in Ubud and it serves as a tourist attraction hotspot due to its wildlife as well as religious value. There are around 115 species of various kinds of trees and monkeys who are always on the lookout for getting some treats from the tourists, this is a delightful place for nature lovers. Spread of 12.5 hectares of land, this place is owned by the Pandangetal community. Apart from the monkeys, there are also Timor Rusa Deer who are kept because of their beauty. The temples here date back to the 14th century and are constructed with amazing sculptures and carvings of dragons and monkeys. This is a great place to head to for some fun time with playful monkeys.

Location: Jl. Monkey Forest, Ubud, Kecamatan Ubud, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80571, Indonesia

Timings:9 AM to 5 PM

Entry fee:IDR 80,000

Things to do: Play with the monkeys, visit the deer, look at the carvings.

Highlights: Play with the monkeys, dont forget to take treats.

Related Post: Bali Temples

24. Uluwatu - Surfers Delight

Located at the southern tip of Bukit in Bali, Uluwatu beach attracts lots of surfers from all over the world who have varying experience levels. Uluwatu is formed of two words- Ulu, which means lands end, and water, which means rock. This is because its waves are made up of five world-class surf breaks. If you love surfing, bring your board and test your skills, but if you would much rather relax, plenty of hotels and restaurants give a beautiful view of the ocean in all its glory. When here, check out the Pura Luru Uluwatu temple of this region. The clear blue waters of the place are perfect for a getaway.

Location:Uluwatu, Bali, Indonesia

Timings:7 AM to 7 PM

Entry fee:IDR 15,000

Things to do: Go surfing, Enjoy the water sports, enjoy the delicious cuisine.

Highlights: The beautiful waves breaking over the shoreline.

25. Dream Beach - Beautiful Panoramic Views

This is definitely the most famous out of the three Nusa Islands. Dream Beach is a remote 115 meters of a pristine stretch of white sand on the southwestern coast of Nusa Lembongan. But theres more to enjoy apart from the sand and surf. While here, check out the low-lying cliffs and rock formations. From the beach, you can get beautiful panoramic views of the ocean and it is known for its peacefulness as well since the usual hustle and bustle of tourists isnt here. Getting ready to explore one of the best places to visit in Bali, bars near Dream Beach to soak in all the charming sandy vibes.

Location:495, W Goa, ROCKPOOL, 2, Vagator Beach Rd, Vagator, Goa 403509

Timings:9 AM to 10 PM

Entry fee:Free

Things to do: Go surfing, take photographs, visit the Rick formations

Highlights: The rock formations.

Related Post: Bali Fun World

26. Pura Taman Ayun - Mengwi Dynasty

Constructed in 1634 by the Mengwi dynasty so as to honour his ancestors, the Pura Taman Ayun, translated to Beautiful Garden, is an ancient Taman Ayun temple located in Mengwi, Bali. The gateway of the Temple is beautifully ornamented and leads to a beautiful fountain that sprouts water through its nine jets. These nine jets represent the nine gods in the Hindu Pantheon. There is an old-world charm to this place, like it belongs to a time of the past, and perhaps that is the reason why visitors flock here throughout the whole year.

Location: Jl. Ayodya No.10, Mengwi, Kec. Mengwi, Kabupaten Badung, Bali 80351, Indonesia

Timings:8 AM to 6.15 PM

Entry fee:IDR 15,000

Things to do: Look at the carvings and sculptures and take pictures.

Highlights: The Fountain.

27. Waterbom Bali - Asias Best Waterpark

It is called Asias best waterpark and is located in South Kuta; this place offers a thrilling day to its visitors. Bring your family and friends to this island with numerous rides that will suit everyone. Theres the Lazy River Ride for those wanting to take the day slowly and relax a little; theres also the Boomerang ride, full of adrenaline-pumping 20-metre tall fall of thrill. The rides at Waterbom waterpark range from mild to extreme, making the park more versatile. The park is clean and green, apart from being decorated in a specific way which just gives enough shade to protect visitors from the burning sun above. There are lots of dining options here as well, and apart from this, there are some affordable Javanese massages along with a fish foot spa inside the park, which would delight anyone.

Location: Jl. Kartika Plaza, Tuban, Kec. Kuta, Kabupaten Badung, Bali 80361, Indonesia

Timings:9 AM to 6 PM

Entry fee:IDR 355,000

Things to do: Go on the rides, enjoy the food, have a message.

Highlights: The Thrilling and adventurous rides.

Related Post: Nightlife in Bali

28. Museum Negeri Propinsi Bali - Illuminating Hours

This is the best museum if you want to explore Balinese Culture. This central museum is situated in the provincial capital of Denpasar and houses more than 10,000 artworks. There are a lot of pieces on display in here which include everything from prehistoric sarcophagi to dance costumes as well as masks. The Museum Negeri Propinsi is also known as the Provincial Public State Museum. Make sure to see the various pavilions which examine the different facets of the history and culture of the place. The whole ambience of the place is enhanced by the traditional music that plays on bamboo instruments. The best time to visit this place is in the afternoon as it is less quiet then. Do visit interesting places near Museum Negeri Propinsi for the best experience.

Location: Jl. Mayor Wisnu No.1, Dangin Puri, Kec. Denpasar Tim., Kota Denpasar, Bali 80232, Indonesia

Timings:8 AM to 4 PM

Entry fee:Rp 20000

Things to do: Observe the artefacts, pictures, sculptures and such; listen to music.

Highlights:Explore and indulge in the essence of Balinese Culture

29. Balangan Beach - Stunning Golden Sands

Situated around 20 km to the south of Kuta,Balangan Beach is a picturesque beach that is well known for its beautiful golden sands and surfable waves. The place attracts surfers from around the world, especially to the hill from where the beach descends, as it offers amazing panoramic views. The beautiful beach in itself is dotted with warungs who serve refreshments. This is ideal for surfers who are looking to test themselves. Note that the beach is devoid of lifeguards, making it unsafe. Its shimmering white sandy landscape contrasts well with the glistening blue water of the ocean. Make sure to come here during sunset to see something magical.

Location:Balangan Beach, South Kuta, Bali, Indonesia

Timings:8 AM to 5 PM

Entry fee:Free

Things to do: Surfing, photography, sunbathing

Highlights:Enjoy panoramic views and bask in surfable waves

Related Post: Things To Do In Bali In October

30. Double Six Beach - Relaxed Ambiance

The Double Six Beach is located in Seminyak and has a very relaxed ambience with its blue waters and golden sands. Tourists can relax in the sun during the day when the sun is high and hot. It is also a great place to engage in surfing. If you feel hungry while here, there are many restaurants located across the beach, making it a very lively place to be in. This is amongst the most happening place in Bali during Christmas and New Year weekend! Don't forget to indulge in adventurous things to do near Double Six Beach while holidaying here.

Location: Jalan Double Six, Seminyak, Kuta, Badung, Bali, Indonesia

Timings:Open 24 hours

Entry fee:Free

Things to do: Go surfing, open your parasols and engage in sunbathing, do some photography

Highlights:Delight in surfing and various water activities

31. Goa Gajah - Buddhist Carvings

Goa Gajah is located just six kilometres from Ubud, and the name of the place is the elephant cave. It is a popular cultural and spiritual attraction site which is filled up with Shaivite relics as well as Buddhist carvings. When you enter the place, a very big demon-like structure will wait for you at the entrance. Then, you are led to a tranquil pool inside the place. This place's intricate carvings and stonework make it a must-visit for people looking at Indonesian architecture and heritage in more detail. This place depicts the architecture and history of Bali. This is surely one of the best places to visit in Bali if you wish to witness their glorious craftsmanship! The place is not to be missed on your Bali sightseeing places wish list!

Location: Bedulu, Blahbatuh, Gianyar Regency, Bali, Indonesia

Timings:8 AM to 6 PM

Entry fee:IDR 50,000

Things to do:Explore the cave, visit the bathing pools, stroll around the gardens

Highlights:Admire the ancient structures and architecture

Related Post: Waterfalls In Bali

32. Campuhan Ridge Walk - Central Highlands

On this trek, you will walk through various landscapes that highlight the central highland part of Ubud. It provided a pleasant escape from the congested streets of the towns and into the splendid greenery. You will trod on hidden trails and click amazing pictures of the scenery that encompasses the place; its truly like surrendering oneself to nature. You dont have to worry about entry fees because it is free of cost and is open for all days of the week. This is one of the most popular Bali attractions.

Location: Kelusa, Payangan, Jl. Raya Campuhan, Sayan, Kecamatan Ubud, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali 80571, Indonesia

Timings:Open 24 hours

Come here for the never-ending buffets and the beer pints. Then, go off to the dance floor on the rooftop, where the DJ plays trending times. Dance your heart out with the crows and enjoy to your hearts content. This is definitely a night owls favourite hanging-out spot. It is open from 9 am till 4pm on all days of the week. For party lovers, this place is among Bali's top attractions.

Location: Jln Legian No.61, Kuta, Badung Regency, Bali 80361, Indonesia

Internationally famous DJs, as well as local artists, set the house on fire. This place is perfect for those who want to have fun, get wild drinks and party like a rock star. It is open from about 11 pm to 4pm. This is another electrifying places to go in Bali.

35. Sundays Beach Club - In-house Party Spot


This is a popular beach club which has an in-house party spot as part of the Ungasan Clifftop Resort. The Sundays Beach Club is a small hut-like cabin with a detailed thatched roof and a beach setting. Here, people can spend the whole night either by going to the beach at night to experience the serenity of the lonesome waves or watching the early morning sunrise from there to enjoy the peacefulness of it all. As for drinks, the round bar is stocked full with it, and the club also has a kitchen, which operates on a first come, first served policy. Its really like a small paradise sitting right on the edge of the Ungasan Village. This is one of the most preferred places to visit in Bali for honeymoon.

Location: Jl. Pantai Sel. Gau Banjar Wijaya Kusuma, Ungasan, Kec. Kuta Sel., Kabupaten Badung, Bali 80362, Indonesia

Get ready to be high from the music, setting and the view of it all. The club opens its doors from around 4 pm to 12 am. This is amongst the famous places in Bali for party.

38. Yellow Flower Cafe - Delicious Coffees


Located right in the Penestanan hills, there is a cave shaped like a cafe. This Yellow Flower Cafe is run by an oval family and the surroundings there are enveloped in luscious greenery. Having breakfast here is just glorious. Take a seat here to taste some authentic Asian and Balinese food. The owners have grown their own vegetables to support local farming communities, so everything that they taste is fresh and healthy. The setup is eco-friendly with simple decor so visitors can experiment with its authenticity. This is a must-visit place to try out the Balinese Buffet every Sunday for dinner. 39. Seasalt Seminyak - Scrumptious Delicacies

41. Sukawati Art Market - Regular Shopping Spot

You can find everything from contemporary art to sculptured wooden showpieces in here. Homemade Balinese products are a mainstay in this market. The Sukawati Art Market is locally popular as Pasar Seni Sukawati. This is a two-story building that was established sometime in the 80s. A regular shopping spot for vacationers, you can find everything from clothes to handbags, traditional kites and more. But art is the mainstay of this market. So, if youre in the mood to find some handmade artwork in Bali, this is one of the best places to visit in Bali! Don't forget to explore the gorgeous islands near Sukawati Art Market, which will give you the perfect chance to enjoy a vacation amidst nature!

45. Pura Ulun Danu Bratan – Spiritual Encounters

Bali is an island of temples. There are numerous temples or institutions of spirituality and faith and each one of them is unique and beautiful. Pura Ulun Danu Bratan is one of the most popular Bali attractions visited by tourists in large numbers. The 17th-century temple is located amidst picturesque scenery and is surrounded by water from all sides. It is one of the top 5 places to visit in Bali. The Bedugul mountain range overlooks the temple adding charm to the landscape. This is one of the most popular places to visit in Bali.

48. Garuda Wishnu – Religious Site

A vast cultural park sprawling in the Badung Region of Bali, Garuda Wishnu Kencana Cultural Park is where culture, peace, nature, and spirituality all fuse. This is one of the best Bali destinations. You will find several man-made attractions inside the park, including the large statue of Garuda Wishnu. It is one of the best places to visit in Bali for first timers. This is surely among the best Bali tourist attractions. It is 120 m tall and exudes peace and serenity. You should visit this place if you are travelling to Bali with family. The statue stands as a symbol of the islands religious belief. This is one of the most popular places to visit in Bali. You can also plan a visit to beautiful places near Garuda Wishnu.

53. Tirta Ganga Royal Water Garden – Perfect Picnic Spot

Tirta Gang Royal Water Garden is one of the best places in Bali that you must visit on your honeymoon or family vacation. Built in 1948 by the Karangasem family, you will find a royal palace in the centre surrounded by water. You will also find numerous statues and water fountains adorning the gardens. This is among the amazing places to visit near Taman Tirta Gangga Bali in October. As the water of this garden is used for religious activities, hence it holds a great religious significance in the history of the region.

Location: HHQQ+836, Jalan Raya Abang Desa Adat Jl. Raya Tirta Gangga, Ababi, Kec. Abang, Kabupaten Karangasem, Bali 80852, Indonesia

Entry fee:IDR 50000

54. Bali Zoo – Rare Species

Home to a diverse range of species, including African lions, white tigers, orangutans and elephants. The zoo is one of the best tourist places in Bali, set amidst 8 hectares of dense tropical forest, offering absolute wilderness to explore the wild side of Bali and make friends with some of its inhabitants. The zoo also features some unique wildlife experiences like Breakfast with Orangutans, Night at the Zoo, Elephant mud fun and more. Not just one of the popular Bali tourist spots but it is also one of the amazing Bali famous places that you should include in your next Bali itinerary.

56. Ubud Monkey Forest – Spend A Day Amidst Wildlife

Nestled away from all the hustle-bustle, the Ubud Monkey Forest is one of the ideal Bali destinations to enjoy a relaxing time. This forest is home to around 700 Balinese long-tailed monkeys, and it is also considered sacred among the locals. In addition to this, there are 186 species of trees and plants, along with 3 famous Hindu temples, which are the main highlights of the forest. Alongside that, one can also experience things like nature walks and feeding the monkeys.

Location: Jalan Monkey Forest, Ubud, Kabupaten Gianyar, Bali

Entry fee: INR 400 /IDR 80,000

Timing: 8:30 am to 5:30 pm

Things to do:Watching monkeys, adventurous rides, hiking

Highlights:Enjoy nature walks and feeding the monkeys

59. Subak Museum: See Balinese Agricultural Tools

Subak Museum is one of the best places to visit in Bali if you want to learn about Bali agriculture in detail. The museum showcases Balinese agricultural tools, old documentation and a statue of everything related to Bali agriculture. Preserving the rich cultural heritage of the island, this museum has a great significance and hold a very special place in the heart of locals and tourist alike. Along with educating visitors about the history of Bali, this museum also adds an amazing experience in their travelling diaries. If you are fond of sustainable farming practices then this place is no less than a paradise for you.

Location: Jl. Gatot Subroto No.5b, Banjar Anyar, Kec. Kediri, Kabupaten Tabanan, Bali 82121, Indonesia

Timings: 8 AM to 3.30 PM, closed on Weekends

Entry fee:RP 5.000

Things to do: Tanah Lot, Tabanan Butterfly Park, Jatiluwih Rice TerraceHot Spring, Alas Kedaton, and Watukaru Temple are some of the popular attractions located nearby Subak Museum.

Highlights:Observe the sustainable farming practices of Bali

 

Related Post: Bali In April

60. Bali Treetop Adventure Park: Try Different Fun Activity

Bali treetop adventure park is one of the most famous places to see in Bali with friends. It is located within the Bali botanical garden and offers fun and entertainment to people of all ages. Famous for adventure activities and its beautiful natural setting, you can admire nature all around you once you are tired of the fun activities. Holding the dignity of being one of the first high rope courses built in Asia, the Bali Treetop Adventure Park is a thrilling circuits which is packed with challenging surprises for the people of all ages. From zip lines to suspension bridges, there is no lack of adventure in this amazing park.

Location: Eka Karya Botanic Garden Bali, Candikuning, Bedugul, Baturiti, Tabanan, Bali 82191, Indonesia

Timings:9 AM to 6 PM

Entry fee: IDR 800,000

Things to do: Climb up spider nets, high rope bridges and grip onto trapezes, enjoy picturesque views

Highlights:Enjoy thrilling activities and spend a joyful day with your friends and family

 

You May Also Like To Read: Bali Mountains

Excited to explore the top places to visit in Bali? Make sure you add all the best places to visit in Bali and experience the best Bali tourist attractions in this tropical paradise! But before that, plan your trip to Bali and experience the bliss. The more we say about Bali, the less it is. This magical spot on Earth can only be better understood with a visit. And while you visit this place, do let us know in the comments about your experience!

Frequently Asked Questions About Bali Tourist Attractions

Which are the best places to visit in Bali for honeymoon?

Here are some of the best places to visit in Bali for couples are Mount Batur, Tanah Lot Temple, Nusa Dua, Seminyak and Ubud.

What is the best area to visit in Bali?

Sanur beach, Nusa Lembongan, Lovina, Pura Luhur Uluwatu, Mount Batur, Kuta Beach, Pura Besakih are some of the best places to visit in Bali which are known for their tropical beauty and picturesque landscapes which are worth a visit.

What are the best things to do in Bali?

Enjoy various adventure sports in Bali, go on beach hopping and exploring various cafes and restaurants are among the top things to do in Bali.

Which are the best beaches in Bali?

If you are looking for the top places to visit in Bali with family then you can explore its amazing beaches, such as Nusa Dua, Kelingking Beach, Kuta Beach, Sanur Beach and Seminyak Beach.

What is the most beautiful place to visit in Bali?

Some of the most beautiful places to visit in Bali is Pura Ulun Danu Bratan, Nusa Dua beach, Uluwatu temple Pura Tanah Lot and Mount Batur which are famous for its beautiful landscapes and experiences which can be cherished throughout the time.

What is famous in Bali for shopping?

Bali is famous for handicrafts like the Balinese silver jewellery, Batik fabric and clothing, Bali ceramics, Organic beauty products which can be bought as a souvenir along with Kopi Luwak coffee and chocolates.

How many days are enough in Bali?

If you plan to explore just the main island, a week in Bali is enough. If you plan to visit the nearby islands like the Gili and Nusa islands, it will take at least 8 days.

When is the cheapest month to visit Bali?

February is considered the cheapest month to fly to Bali, while flights in September might be very costly for people planning a trip.

Why is Bali famous?

Bali is also called the Land of the Gods and is known for its natural beauty and also the active volcanoes and terraced rice fields. This is also a paradise for the surfers.

What is illegal in Bali?

The drug laws in Bali are very strict and should not be taken easily. People carrying drugs get life imprisonment for the possession or maybe life imprisonment if convicted of trafficking.

Which are the best restaurants in Bali?

Here is the list of the best restaurants in Bali where you can enjoy delicious local delicacies.
1. Ankhusa Restaurant
2. Queens Tandoor
3. Opia Bali

Which are the most famous hotels in Bali?

The most famous hotels in Bali that offer impeccable services are Hamsa Resort, Viceroy Bali, and Hanging Gardens of Bali.
